info.description: Azure DevOps provides services for teams to share code, track work, and ship software - for any language, all in a single package. It's the perfect complement to your IDE.
info.title: Azure DevOps

get.description: Retrieves the list of Organizations the user is a member of.
Retrieves the list of iterations for a project.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The name of the Organization. This can be found in the instance URL i.e. {Organization}.visualstudio.com. The Organization should have "Third-party application access via OAuth" enabled to prevent errors in the operation.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The name of the project within the specified Organization.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: The name of the team within the project.

get.description: Retrieves the list of build defintions in a project.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The name of the Organization. This can be found in the instance URL i.e. {Organization}.visualstudio.com. The Organization should have "Third-party application access via OAuth" enabled to prevent errors in the operation.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The name of the project within the specified Organization.

post.description: Create a build, based on an existing build definition, and add it to the build queue.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The name of the Organization. This can be found in the instance URL i.e. {Organization}.visualstudio.com. The Organization should have "Third-party application access via OAuth" enabled to prevent errors in the operation.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The name of the project within the specified Organization.

parameters.name: buildDefId
parameters.description: The identifier of the build definition to use.

parameters.name: buildDetails
parameters.description: The JSON body of the request.

get.description: Triggers a flow when a build completes.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The name of the Organization. This can be found in the instance URL i.e. {Organization}.visualstudio.com. The Organization should have "Third-party application access via OAuth" enabled to prevent errors in the operation.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The name of the project within the specified Organization.

parameters.name: resultFilter
parameters.description: An option indicating which build result to trigger on. Valid options include '', 'succeeded', 'partiallySucceeded', 'failed', or 'canceled'.

parameters.name: definitions
parameters.description: An option indicating which build definition id to trigger on.

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, wait for a build to complete.

post.description: Triggers a flow when a build completes.

parameters.name: subscription
parameters.description: Subscription information.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The name of the Organization. This can be found in the instance URL i.e. {Organization}.visualstudio.com. The Organization should have "Third-party application access via OAuth" enabled to prevent errors in the operation.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The name of the project within the specified Organization.

post.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, wait for a build to complete.

get.description: Triggers a flow when code is pushed to a Git repository.

get.summary: When a pull request is created (Git)

parameters.description: The name of the repository within the specified project.

parameters.name: targetRefName
parameters.description: The name of the Git ref, such as a branch or tag.

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work, create a pull request in the Git repo you selected.

get.description: Triggers a flow when code is checked in to a Team Foundation Version Control project.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The name of the project within the specified Organization.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: The name of the team which to select an author.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: The unique name of the team member who authored the check in.

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work, check code into the TFVC project you selected.

post.summary: Send an HTTP request to Azure DevOps
post.description: Construct an Azure DevOps REST API request to invoke. Please refer to the following link for all available endpoints: https://docs.microsoft.com/rest/api/azure/devops

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The name of the Organization. This can be found in the instance URL i.e. {Organization}.visualstudio.com. The Organization should have "Third-party application access via OAuth" enabled to prevent errors in the operation.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters to this operation passed in the body.

get.description: Retrieves the list of Work Item Types accessible in a given Azure DevOps project.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The name of the Organization. This can be found in the instance URL i.e. {Organization}.visualstudio.com. The Organization should have "Third-party application access via OAuth" enabled to prevent errors in the operation.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The name of the project within the specified Organization.

get.description: Get the details of a single work item.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The name of the Organization. This can be found in the instance URL i.e. {Organization}.visualstudio.com. The Organization should have "Third-party application access via OAuth" enabled to prevent errors in the operation.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The name of the project within the specified Organization.

parameters.name: typeName
parameters.description: The work item type of the work item.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique id of the work item to get details for.The work item must be of the type specified in 'Work Item Type'.

patch.description: Update an existing work item by id.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The name of the Organization. This can be found in the instance URL i.e. {Organization}.visualstudio.com. The Organization should have "Third-party application access via OAuth" enabled to prevent errors in the operation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique id of the work item to update.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The name of the project within the specified Organization.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The work item type to generate schema for.

parameters.name: workItem
parameters.description: The details of the work item.

get.description: Get a list of children (max size 1000) of a single work item.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The name of the Organization. This can be found in the instance URL i.e. {Organization}.visualstudio.com. The Organization should have "Third-party application access via OAuth" enabled to prevent errors in the operation.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The name of the project within the specified Organization.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique id of the work item to get the children for.

parameters.name: workItemType
parameters.description: The type of the children work item(s)

patch.description: Create a new work item with the provided attributes.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The name of the Organization. This can be found in the instance URL i.e. {Organization}.visualstudio.com. The Organization should have "Third-party application access via OAuth" enabled to prevent errors in the operation.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The name of the project within the specified Organization.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of this work item

parameters.name: shouldReturnAllFields
parameters.description: When setting the value to 'No', only the work item ID will be returned. If the value is 'Yes', all fields of the created Item along with the ID will be returned. The default value is 'Yes'

parameters.name: workItem
parameters.description: Information to include in the new work item

get.summary: When a work item is assigned
get.description: Triggers a flow when a work item which matches provided criteria is assigned to the given user.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The name of the Organization. This can be found in the instance URL i.e. {Organization}.visualstudio.com. The Organization should have "Third-party application access via OAuth" enabled to prevent errors in the operation.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The name of the project within the specified Organization.

parameters.name: wiql__System_AssignedTo
parameters.description: The name of the team member who currently owns the work item.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: The name of the team from which to select a member.

parameters.name: wiql__System_WorkItemType
parameters.description: The name of the work item type.

parameters.name: wiql__System_AreaPath
parameters.description: The product feature or team area the work item is in.

parameters.name: areaPathComparison
parameters.description: The rule to be used while comparing Area Path field.

parameters.name: wiql__System_IterationPath
parameters.description: The named sprint or time period the work item is in.

parameters.name: iterationPathComparison
parameters.description: The rule to be used while comparing Iteration Path field.

parameters.name: wiql__Microsoft_VSTS_Common_Priority
parameters.description: A subjective rating of the bug, issue, task, or test case as it relates to the business.

parameters.name: wiql__System_TeamProject
parameters.description: The team project to which this work item belongs.

parameters.name: wiql__System_CreatedBy
parameters.description: The name of the team member who created the work item.

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, assign a work item to the user you selected

get.description: Retrieves the result of a work item query.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The name of the Organization. This can be found in the instance URL i.e. {Organization}.visualstudio.com. The Organization should have "Third-party application access via OAuth" enabled to prevent errors in the operation.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The name of the project within the specified Organization.

parameters.name: queryId
parameters.description: The Id of the stored query to run.

get.description: Retrieves the result of a work item query.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The name of the Organization. This can be found in the instance URL i.e. {Organization}.visualstudio.com. The Organization should have "Third-party application access via OAuth" enabled to prevent errors in the operation.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The name of the project within the specified Organization.

parameters.name: queryId
parameters.description: The Id of the stored query to run.

parameters.name: workItemsCount
parameters.description: Max work items count to retrieve (1 - 20000)
parameters.x-ms-summary: Number of work items to return

parameters.name: throwIfQueryChanged
parameters.description: If query results change during flow execution then flow run should fail to avoid inconsistencies.

parameters.name: queryHash
parameters.description: Hash value to detect changes in the query results.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of items to skip to get next work items.

get.description: Returns a list of work items.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The name of the Organization. This can be found in the instance URL i.e. {Organization}.visualstudio.com. The Organization should have "Third-party application access via OAuth" enabled to prevent errors in the operation.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The name of the project within the specified Organization.

parameters.name: workItemIds
parameters.description: The comma-separated list of requested work item IDs.

parameters.name: workItemType
parameters.description: The work item type to generate schema for.

noFastForward.description: A two-parent, no-fast-forward merge. The source branch is unchanged. This is the default behavior.

rebase.description: Rebase the source branch on top of the target branch HEAD commit, and fast-forward the target branch.

rebaseMerge.description: Rebase the source branch on top of the target branch HEAD commit, and create a two-parent, no-fast-forward merge.

squash.description: Put all changes from the pull request into a single-parent commit.

conflictAuthorshipCommits.description: If true, conflict resolutions applied during the merge will be put in separate commits to preserve authorship info for git blame.

detectRenameFalsePositives.description: If true, detects rename false positives.

disableRenames.description: If true, rename detection will not be performed during the merge.

autoCompleteIgnoreConfigIds.description: List of any policy configuration Id's which auto-complete should not wait for

bypassPolicy.description: If true, policies will be explicitly bypassed while the pull request is completed.

bypassReason.description: If policies are bypassed, this reason is stored as to why bypass was used.

deleteSourceBranch.description: If true, the source branch of the pull request will be deleted after completion.

mergeCommitMessage.description: If set, this will be used as the commit message of the merge commit.

squashMerge.description: If MergeStrategy is not set, the merge strategy will be no-fast-forward if this flag is false, or squash if true.

transitionWorkItems.description: If true, we will attempt to transition any work items linked to the pull request into the next logical state (i.e. Active -> Resolved).
